item.description:
The Appleseed Program is designed to take you from simply being a rifle owner to being a true Rifleman. All throughout American history, the Rifleman has been defined as a marksman capable of hitting targets from 500 yards away! This 500-yard range is traditionally known as "the rifleman's quarter-mile;" a rifleman can hit just about any target he can see.

Learn the "Six Steps to Firing a Shot," the proper use of a sling, the correct firing positions, Natural Point of Aim (NPOA), and how to adjust your sights. Along the way we'll teach you little-known secrets of Revolutionary War history, about your birthright, and the heritage of the American Rifleman.

What to bring:

  • A Desire to Learn
  • Your Favorite Rifles & Slings (.22LR Recommended --- Scopes are ok)
  • Approximately 400 rounds of ammo per day
  • Eye & Ear Protection
  • Carpet Remnant or Shooting Mat
  • A Quart (or more) of water
  • Trail Mix, Snacks, etc.
  • Friends!


What you can expect


  • New Shooters -- To learn the fundamentals and to make quick progress
  • Experienced Shooters -- To learn how to tighten your groups
  • Expert Shooters -- To polish your shooting AND your teaching skills.
  • Everyone -- To have more fun with a rifle than you've ever had before!


Learn More at: www.appleseedinfo.org

Walk-on fees are $80 for both days, or $50 for one day. Pre-register, be sure of a place and save! $70 for both days or $45 for one day. Shooters under 21, active military (including reserves and guard) and women shoot for FREE!

For other assistance, contact John at 888.221.8628 or nh@appleseedinfo.org
item.name: Appleseed Shoot
